newsArray.title: Former Pakistan Captain Misbah-ul-Haq Set to Work With PCB Again, Likely to Be Named Head of Cricket Committee and Advisor to Chief Zaka Ashraf: Report
newsArray.description: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to return to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) nearly two years after he resigned as head coach of the national team.
newsArray.content: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to return to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) nearly two years after he resigned as head coach of the national team, as reported by ESPNcricinfo. According to ESPNcricinfo, he will also be the advisor on cricketing affairs to the current head of the PCB, Zaka Ashraf. IND vs WI ODI Series 2023: Shimron Hetmyer Recalled As West Indies Name 15-Member Squad; Nicholas Pooran, Jason Holder Unavailable for Selection. The upcoming appointment is the first significant step the new leadership would take in managing Pakistan cricket. After a brief legal snafu in late June, when Najam Sethi's term as caretaker chairman came to an end, Ashraf was chosen to lead the PCB's new executive committee. Misbah's position is anticipated to be an honorary one, which means he won't receive compensation. After their Monday meeting, he came to a final conclusion. тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain! It signifies Misbah's return nearly two years after his resignation in September 2021, just before Ramiz Raja was named PCB chairman. Since then, he has served as an expert and analyst for a number of TV networks, roles he is likely to keep up. In September 2019, Mickey Arthur's position as head coach was replaced by Misbah, who also served as coach and chief selector for Pakistan. When Arthur led the Test team for a year, when Pakistan rose to the top of the international rankings, he had played under Arthur. Misbah succeeded Arthur as head coach and assumed the duties of chief selector after Arthur's resignation. (ANI) (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

newsArray.title: Australian soccer royalty is spotted hanging out with under-fire skipper Pat Cummins ahead of fifth Ashes Test - after sacked AFL coach Stuart Dew joined team in England
newsArray.description: Former Socceroos captain and English Premier League defender Lucas Neill has been spotted with Test captain Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford.
newsArray.content: Australian soccer royalty is spotted hanging out with under-fire skipper Pat Cummins ahead of fifth Ashes Test - after sacked AFL coach Stuart Dew joined team in England Lucas Neill spotted with Pat Cummins Neill has been reclusive in recent years He now coaches his son's cricket team By James Cooney For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 07:32 BST, 25 July 2023 e-mail View comments Former Socceroos captain and English Premier League defender Lucas Neill has been spotted with Test captain Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford. Just a week after sacked former Suns coach Stuart Dew made a bizarre move to join the Australian Ashes squad, the reclusive ex-skipper was spotted with Cummins and coach Andrew McDonald. The 45-year-old former Everton , West Ham and Blackburn defender, who played 96 times for his country, has seemingly severed ties with the Australian football community since he was axed from the top job by Ange Postecoglou on the eve of the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Neill was declared bankrupt in Britain in 2016 after a series of failed investments - despite earning nearly $40 million in his career. He now lives in Lancashire with his wife and two kids, and coaches his son Marcus' junior cricket team at local club Lowerhouse. Lucas Neill has been spotted with Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford Sacked former Suns coach Stuart Dew was pictured with the team last week Neill has made a couple of public appearances over the years, most recently when Tony Gustavsson was officially confirmed as the Matildas coach at an event in London. 'I was honoured to do so,' Neill said at the time. 'This is a very important era for the Matildas and Australian football. Having spent the day with Tony, it is evident how passionate and determined he is to be successful and develop talent. 'His emotion combined with his attention to detail has me believing that there are exciting times ahead. 'I wish Tony, the staff, and all the Matildas all the very best as they embark on an amazing four-year journey.' Postecoglou has since said he regrets the way that Neill's Socceroo career came to an end. 'Being the captain and leader of the country for such a long time, Lucas had had a celebrated career. Regrettably it finished on the end of a phone line,' Postecoglou wrote in Changing The Game. 'The end for Lucas shouldnтАЩt have been a call from me telling him he wasnтАЩt going to the 2014 World Cup. I wonder if he would have felt any better if IтАЩd told him in person. Maybe I should have taken him out to dinner.' Neill, who played 96 times for his country, has seemingly severed ties with the Australian football community Neill was declared bankrupt in Britain in 2016 after a series of failed investments In his heyday, Neill attracted interest from superclubs such as Liverpool, but ultimately chose to stay on as captain at West Ham. Neill, who made his international debut in 1996, led Australia 60 times but was left out of the Socceroos' 2014 World Cup squad, spelling the end of his international career. As well as England, he had stints with clubs in Turkey, the Middle East and Japan. newsArray.title: Harmanpreet Kaur To Miss Two Knockout Matches in Asian Games 2023 Due to On-Field Outburst During IND-W vs BAN-W 3rd ODI 2023: Report
newsArray.description: The recent on-field outburst by India captain Harmanpreet Kaur during the tied third ODI against Bangladesh at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium may result in her missing two knockout matches of the womenтАЩs T20 event in the Asian Games to be held in Hangzhou, China.
newsArray.content: The recent on-field outburst by India captain Harmanpreet Kaur during the tied third ODI against Bangladesh at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium may result in her missing two knockout matches of the womenтАЩs T20 event in the Asian Games to be held in Hangzhou, China. According to a report in Cricbuzz, the International Cricket Council (ICC) is expected to come down heavily on her conduct, adding that Harmanpreet could be hit with four demerit points, resulting in a suspension for two international games. тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain! The women's T20 cricket event in the Asian Games starts on September 19. тАЬThe Indian team, based on its ICC ranking, has qualified directly for the quarterfinals. If Harmanpreet accumulates four demerit points, she could potentially miss the quarterfinal and semifinal, both knockout matches, and only be eligible to play in the final, the gold medal clash, if the team progresses that far,тАЭ added the report. In IndiaтАЩs chase of 226, Harmanpreet went for a sweep off Nahida Akter in the 34th over. But Harmanpreet missed the delivery and the ball seemingly went to slip off the pads. On NahidaтАЩs appeal, the umpire raised the finger, leaving Harmanpreet furious. In anger, she hit the stumps with her bat and exchanged a few angry words with the umpire before walking towards the pavilion. On the way, she showed a thumbs up to the crowd when she reached the boundary ropes. Virat Kohli Shows Nice Gesture By Giving Autographed Bats to Port of Spain Museum After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ended in A Draw (See Pic) Later on, in the post-match presentation ceremony, she came down heavily on umpiring in the match, calling it тАЬpatheticтАЭ, while adding that she was тАЬreally disappointedтАЭ with some decisions. "When a player reaches four or more demerit points within 24 months, they are converted into suspension points, resulting in a ban. Two suspension points equate to a ban from one Test or two ODIs or two T20Is, whichever comes first for the player. Demerit Points remain on a player's disciplinary record for 24 months from their imposition, after which they will be expunged," says the ICC Code of Conduct. The report added that the ICC was expected to announce the sanctions on Monday, but there might be a delay due to procedural issues. тАЬAs per standard practice, the match officials have submitted a report to the ICC and the home board, in this case, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI),тАЭ it added. It further said Harmanpreet is understood to have acknowledged her culpability in principle, but whether she actually signed off on it is not known. тАЬOnce the sanctions are announced, Harmanpreet has the right to appeal, in which case the ICC match referee will conduct a hearing,тАЭ concluded the report. (The above story first appeared on LatestLY on Jul 25, 2023 11:26 AM IST. For more news and updates on politics, world, sports, entertainment and lifestyle, log on to our website latestly.com ).

newsArray.title: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan says two Australian superstars could RETIRE from Test cricket at final Ashes clash at The Oval
newsArray.description: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring two Aussie superstars are poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval once the Ashes concludes.
newsArray.content: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan says two Australian superstars could RETIRE from Test cricket at final Ashes clash at The Oval Rumour David Warner & Steve Smith about to play final Test matches England great Michael Vaughan dropped bombshell ahead of fifth Test Warner, 36, previously stated he wants one final summer in Australia Smith, 34, regarded by some fans as best player since Sir Don Bradman By Andrew Prentice For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 06:47 BST, 25 July 2023 e-mail View comments Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring David Warner and Steve Smith are both poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval where the Ashes series will conclude. Vaughan, 48, said there was a 'whisper' from reporters at Old Trafford during the fourth Test the two Aussie superstars could call it quits when it comes to the traditional form of the game. If true, it would leave a gaping hole in Australia 's Test team that could take years to fill. 'The whisper in Manchester was....and I have no idea where they [journalists] are getting this whisper, but that Warner, if he plays at The Oval, it will probably be his last Test,' Vaughan said on Fox Cricket. 'And there was [also] quite a strong whisper about Steve Smith that it could be his last time out for Australia as well. Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring David Warner and Steve Smith are poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval Steve Smith (pictured right) made his Test debut in 2010 and is now one of the premier figures in world cricket 'Again, I've not seen that personally, but it's the whisper and the gossip. 'It might have been the rain that gets people talking, but that was the talk of the press box, that a couple of Australian legends might call it a day.' Warner, 36, stated last month he will play his final Test against Pakistan next January in Sydney - but following yet another underwhelming Ashes on English soil with the bat, his place in the XI is anything but guaranteed. Smith, 34, has long been Australia's best player - and while events in Cape Town five years ago under his leadership led to a 12-month suspension and stained his reputation, 'Smudge' is irreplaceable in the eyes of many cricket fans. Some believe he is Australia's best batsman since Sir Donald Bradman, placing him ahead of the likes of fellow greats Allan Border and Steve Waugh. David Warner stated last month he will play his final Test next January in Sydney - but following another underwhelming Ashes on English soil with the bat, his place in the XI isn't guaranteed Meanwhile, former selector Mark Waugh believes Pat Cummins' days are numbered as Australia's captain. 'I think mentally [during the fourth Test in Manchester] he just looked burnt out in the field,' he said. 'There was so much pressure on him captaining the side and field placements and his own bowling suffered. 'You can see it's [captaincy] affecting him and you don't want that to happen to Pat Cummins because he's a key player. 'You don't want him burning out quickly.' The fifth Test at The Oval in London begins on July 27. newsArray.title: тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain!
newsArray.description: The Indian captain spoke about the weather in Trinidad and compared it to that of his city, Mumbai, which has seen a lot of rainfall this monsoon season. Rain led to the India vs West Indies 2nd Test finishing in a draw.
newsArray.content: Rohit Sharma had a hilarious take on the weather in Trinidad after rain led to the India vs West Indies 2nd Test 2023 finishing in a draw . India needed eight wickets to win the match on Day 5, with West Indies requiring 289 runs. The visitors would have backed themselves to get the win after their dominant bowling performance this series, but rain prevented any action from taking place on Day 5. Rohit took to social media to share a picture of him and his teammates standing in the rain in Trinidad and made a reference to Mumbai, which has seen a lot of rainfall this monsoon. Virat Kohli Shows Nice Gesture By Giving Autographed Bats to Port of Spain Museum After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ended in A Draw (See Pic). 'Mumbai Ya Trinidad' Rohit Sharma's Post Goes Viral Mumbai ya Trinidad ЁЯдФЁЯМзя╕П pic.twitter.com/jOPINPXW4a тАФ Rohit Sharma (@ImRo45) July 25, 2023 (SocialLY brings you all the latest breaking news, viral trends and information from social media world, including Twitter, Instagram and Youtube. newsArray.title: Former Pakistan Captain Misbah-ul-Haq Set to Work With PCB Again, Likely to Be Named Head of Cricket Committee and Advisor to Chief Zaka Ashraf: Report
newsArray.description: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to return to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) nearly two years after he resigned as head coach of the national team.
newsArray.content: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to return to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) nearly two years after he resigned as head coach of the national team, as reported by ESPNcricinfo. According to ESPNcricinfo, he will also be the advisor on cricketing affairs to the current head of the PCB, Zaka Ashraf. IND vs WI ODI Series 2023: Shimron Hetmyer Recalled As West Indies Name 15-Member Squad; Nicholas Pooran, Jason Holder Unavailable for Selection. The upcoming appointment is the first significant step the new leadership would take in managing Pakistan cricket. After a brief legal snafu in late June, when Najam Sethi's term as caretaker chairman came to an end, Ashraf was chosen to lead the PCB's new executive committee. Misbah's position is anticipated to be an honorary one, which means he won't receive compensation. After their Monday meeting, he came to a final conclusion. тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain! It signifies Misbah's return nearly two years after his resignation in September 2021, just before Ramiz Raja was named PCB chairman. Since then, he has served as an expert and analyst for a number of TV networks, roles he is likely to keep up. In September 2019, Mickey Arthur's position as head coach was replaced by Misbah, who also served as coach and chief selector for Pakistan. When Arthur led the Test team for a year, when Pakistan rose to the top of the international rankings, he had played under Arthur. Misbah succeeded Arthur as head coach and assumed the duties of chief selector after Arthur's resignation. (ANI) (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

newsArray.title: Australian soccer royalty is spotted hanging out with under-fire skipper Pat Cummins ahead of fifth Ashes Test - after sacked AFL coach Stuart Dew joined team in England
newsArray.description: Former Socceroos captain and English Premier League defender Lucas Neill has been spotted with Test captain Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford.
newsArray.content: Australian soccer royalty is spotted hanging out with under-fire skipper Pat Cummins ahead of fifth Ashes Test - after sacked AFL coach Stuart Dew joined team in England Lucas Neill spotted with Pat Cummins Neill has been reclusive in recent years He now coaches his son's cricket team By James Cooney For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 07:32 BST, 25 July 2023 e-mail View comments Former Socceroos captain and English Premier League defender Lucas Neill has been spotted with Test captain Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford. Just a week after sacked former Suns coach Stuart Dew made a bizarre move to join the Australian Ashes squad, the reclusive ex-skipper was spotted with Cummins and coach Andrew McDonald. The 45-year-old former Everton , West Ham and Blackburn defender, who played 96 times for his country, has seemingly severed ties with the Australian football community since he was axed from the top job by Ange Postecoglou on the eve of the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Neill was declared bankrupt in Britain in 2016 after a series of failed investments - despite earning nearly $40 million in his career. He now lives in Lancashire with his wife and two kids, and coaches his son Marcus' junior cricket team at local club Lowerhouse. Lucas Neill has been spotted with Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford Sacked former Suns coach Stuart Dew was pictured with the team last week Neill has made a couple of public appearances over the years, most recently when Tony Gustavsson was officially confirmed as the Matildas coach at an event in London. 'I was honoured to do so,' Neill said at the time. 'This is a very important era for the Matildas and Australian football. Having spent the day with Tony, it is evident how passionate and determined he is to be successful and develop talent. 'His emotion combined with his attention to detail has me believing that there are exciting times ahead. 'I wish Tony, the staff, and all the Matildas all the very best as they embark on an amazing four-year journey.' Postecoglou has since said he regrets the way that Neill's Socceroo career came to an end. 'Being the captain and leader of the country for such a long time, Lucas had had a celebrated career. Regrettably it finished on the end of a phone line,' Postecoglou wrote in Changing The Game. 'The end for Lucas shouldnтАЩt have been a call from me telling him he wasnтАЩt going to the 2014 World Cup. I wonder if he would have felt any better if IтАЩd told him in person. Maybe I should have taken him out to dinner.' Neill, who played 96 times for his country, has seemingly severed ties with the Australian football community Neill was declared bankrupt in Britain in 2016 after a series of failed investments In his heyday, Neill attracted interest from superclubs such as Liverpool, but ultimately chose to stay on as captain at West Ham. Neill, who made his international debut in 1996, led Australia 60 times but was left out of the Socceroos' 2014 World Cup squad, spelling the end of his international career. As well as England, he had stints with clubs in Turkey, the Middle East and Japan. newsArray.title: Harmanpreet Kaur To Miss Two Knockout Matches in Asian Games 2023 Due to On-Field Outburst During IND-W vs BAN-W 3rd ODI 2023: Report
newsArray.description: The recent on-field outburst by India captain Harmanpreet Kaur during the tied third ODI against Bangladesh at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium may result in her missing two knockout matches of the womenтАЩs T20 event in the Asian Games to be held in Hangzhou, China.
newsArray.content: The recent on-field outburst by India captain Harmanpreet Kaur during the tied third ODI against Bangladesh at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium may result in her missing two knockout matches of the womenтАЩs T20 event in the Asian Games to be held in Hangzhou, China. According to a report in Cricbuzz, the International Cricket Council (ICC) is expected to come down heavily on her conduct, adding that Harmanpreet could be hit with four demerit points, resulting in a suspension for two international games. тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain! The women's T20 cricket event in the Asian Games starts on September 19. тАЬThe Indian team, based on its ICC ranking, has qualified directly for the quarterfinals. If Harmanpreet accumulates four demerit points, she could potentially miss the quarterfinal and semifinal, both knockout matches, and only be eligible to play in the final, the gold medal clash, if the team progresses that far,тАЭ added the report. In IndiaтАЩs chase of 226, Harmanpreet went for a sweep off Nahida Akter in the 34th over. But Harmanpreet missed the delivery and the ball seemingly went to slip off the pads. On NahidaтАЩs appeal, the umpire raised the finger, leaving Harmanpreet furious. In anger, she hit the stumps with her bat and exchanged a few angry words with the umpire before walking towards the pavilion. On the way, she showed a thumbs up to the crowd when she reached the boundary ropes. Virat Kohli Shows Nice Gesture By Giving Autographed Bats to Port of Spain Museum After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ended in A Draw (See Pic) Later on, in the post-match presentation ceremony, she came down heavily on umpiring in the match, calling it тАЬpatheticтАЭ, while adding that she was тАЬreally disappointedтАЭ with some decisions. "When a player reaches four or more demerit points within 24 months, they are converted into suspension points, resulting in a ban. Two suspension points equate to a ban from one Test or two ODIs or two T20Is, whichever comes first for the player. Demerit Points remain on a player's disciplinary record for 24 months from their imposition, after which they will be expunged," says the ICC Code of Conduct. The report added that the ICC was expected to announce the sanctions on Monday, but there might be a delay due to procedural issues. тАЬAs per standard practice, the match officials have submitted a report to the ICC and the home board, in this case, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI),тАЭ it added. It further said Harmanpreet is understood to have acknowledged her culpability in principle, but whether she actually signed off on it is not known. тАЬOnce the sanctions are announced, Harmanpreet has the right to appeal, in which case the ICC match referee will conduct a hearing,тАЭ concluded the report. (The above story first appeared on LatestLY on Jul 25, 2023 11:26 AM IST. For more news and updates on politics, world, sports, entertainment and lifestyle, log on to our website latestly.com ).

newsArray.title: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan says two Australian superstars could RETIRE from Test cricket at final Ashes clash at The Oval
newsArray.description: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring two Aussie superstars are poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval once the Ashes concludes.
newsArray.content: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan says two Australian superstars could RETIRE from Test cricket at final Ashes clash at The Oval Rumour David Warner & Steve Smith about to play final Test matches England great Michael Vaughan dropped bombshell ahead of fifth Test Warner, 36, previously stated he wants one final summer in Australia Smith, 34, regarded by some fans as best player since Sir Don Bradman By Andrew Prentice For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 06:47 BST, 25 July 2023 e-mail View comments Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring David Warner and Steve Smith are both poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval where the Ashes series will conclude. Vaughan, 48, said there was a 'whisper' from reporters at Old Trafford during the fourth Test the two Aussie superstars could call it quits when it comes to the traditional form of the game. If true, it would leave a gaping hole in Australia 's Test team that could take years to fill. 'The whisper in Manchester was....and I have no idea where they [journalists] are getting this whisper, but that Warner, if he plays at The Oval, it will probably be his last Test,' Vaughan said on Fox Cricket. 'And there was [also] quite a strong whisper about Steve Smith that it could be his last time out for Australia as well. Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring David Warner and Steve Smith are poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval Steve Smith (pictured right) made his Test debut in 2010 and is now one of the premier figures in world cricket 'Again, I've not seen that personally, but it's the whisper and the gossip. 'It might have been the rain that gets people talking, but that was the talk of the press box, that a couple of Australian legends might call it a day.' Warner, 36, stated last month he will play his final Test against Pakistan next January in Sydney - but following yet another underwhelming Ashes on English soil with the bat, his place in the XI is anything but guaranteed. Smith, 34, has long been Australia's best player - and while events in Cape Town five years ago under his leadership led to a 12-month suspension and stained his reputation, 'Smudge' is irreplaceable in the eyes of many cricket fans. Some believe he is Australia's best batsman since Sir Donald Bradman, placing him ahead of the likes of fellow greats Allan Border and Steve Waugh. David Warner stated last month he will play his final Test next January in Sydney - but following another underwhelming Ashes on English soil with the bat, his place in the XI isn't guaranteed Meanwhile, former selector Mark Waugh believes Pat Cummins' days are numbered as Australia's captain. 'I think mentally [during the fourth Test in Manchester] he just looked burnt out in the field,' he said. 'There was so much pressure on him captaining the side and field placements and his own bowling suffered. 'You can see it's [captaincy] affecting him and you don't want that to happen to Pat Cummins because he's a key player. 'You don't want him burning out quickly.' The fifth Test at The Oval in London begins on July 27. newsArray.title: тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain!
newsArray.description: The Indian captain spoke about the weather in Trinidad and compared it to that of his city, Mumbai, which has seen a lot of rainfall this monsoon season. Rain led to the India vs West Indies 2nd Test finishing in a draw.
newsArray.content: Rohit Sharma had a hilarious take on the weather in Trinidad after rain led to the India vs West Indies 2nd Test 2023 finishing in a draw . India needed eight wickets to win the match on Day 5, with West Indies requiring 289 runs. The visitors would have backed themselves to get the win after their dominant bowling performance this series, but rain prevented any action from taking place on Day 5. Rohit took to social media to share a picture of him and his teammates standing in the rain in Trinidad and made a reference to Mumbai, which has seen a lot of rainfall this monsoon. newsArray.title: Former Pakistan Captain Misbah-ul-Haq Set to Work With PCB Again, Likely to Be Named Head of Cricket Committee and Advisor to Chief Zaka Ashraf: Report
newsArray.description: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to return to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) nearly two years after he resigned as head coach of the national team.
newsArray.content: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq is set to return to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) nearly two years after he resigned as head coach of the national team, as reported by ESPNcricinfo. According to ESPNcricinfo, he will also be the advisor on cricketing affairs to the current head of the PCB, Zaka Ashraf. IND vs WI ODI Series 2023: Shimron Hetmyer Recalled As West Indies Name 15-Member Squad; Nicholas Pooran, Jason Holder Unavailable for Selection. The upcoming appointment is the first significant step the new leadership would take in managing Pakistan cricket. After a brief legal snafu in late June, when Najam Sethi's term as caretaker chairman came to an end, Ashraf was chosen to lead the PCB's new executive committee. Misbah's position is anticipated to be an honorary one, which means he won't receive compensation. After their Monday meeting, he came to a final conclusion. тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain! It signifies Misbah's return nearly two years after his resignation in September 2021, just before Ramiz Raja was named PCB chairman. Since then, he has served as an expert and analyst for a number of TV networks, roles he is likely to keep up. In September 2019, Mickey Arthur's position as head coach was replaced by Misbah, who also served as coach and chief selector for Pakistan. When Arthur led the Test team for a year, when Pakistan rose to the top of the international rankings, he had played under Arthur. Misbah succeeded Arthur as head coach and assumed the duties of chief selector after Arthur's resignation. (ANI) (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

newsArray.title: Australian soccer royalty is spotted hanging out with under-fire skipper Pat Cummins ahead of fifth Ashes Test - after sacked AFL coach Stuart Dew joined team in England
newsArray.description: Former Socceroos captain and English Premier League defender Lucas Neill has been spotted with Test captain Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford.
newsArray.content: Australian soccer royalty is spotted hanging out with under-fire skipper Pat Cummins ahead of fifth Ashes Test - after sacked AFL coach Stuart Dew joined team in England Lucas Neill spotted with Pat Cummins Neill has been reclusive in recent years He now coaches his son's cricket team By James Cooney For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 07:32 BST, 25 July 2023 e-mail View comments Former Socceroos captain and English Premier League defender Lucas Neill has been spotted with Test captain Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford. Just a week after sacked former Suns coach Stuart Dew made a bizarre move to join the Australian Ashes squad, the reclusive ex-skipper was spotted with Cummins and coach Andrew McDonald. The 45-year-old former Everton , West Ham and Blackburn defender, who played 96 times for his country, has seemingly severed ties with the Australian football community since he was axed from the top job by Ange Postecoglou on the eve of the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Neill was declared bankrupt in Britain in 2016 after a series of failed investments - despite earning nearly $40 million in his career. He now lives in Lancashire with his wife and two kids, and coaches his son Marcus' junior cricket team at local club Lowerhouse. Lucas Neill has been spotted with Pat Cummins following the fifth Ashes match at Old Trafford Sacked former Suns coach Stuart Dew was pictured with the team last week Neill has made a couple of public appearances over the years, most recently when Tony Gustavsson was officially confirmed as the Matildas coach at an event in London. 'I was honoured to do so,' Neill said at the time. 'This is a very important era for the Matildas and Australian football. Having spent the day with Tony, it is evident how passionate and determined he is to be successful and develop talent. 'His emotion combined with his attention to detail has me believing that there are exciting times ahead. 'I wish Tony, the staff, and all the Matildas all the very best as they embark on an amazing four-year journey.' Postecoglou has since said he regrets the way that Neill's Socceroo career came to an end. 'Being the captain and leader of the country for such a long time, Lucas had had a celebrated career. Regrettably it finished on the end of a phone line,' Postecoglou wrote in Changing The Game. 'The end for Lucas shouldnтАЩt have been a call from me telling him he wasnтАЩt going to the 2014 World Cup. I wonder if he would have felt any better if IтАЩd told him in person. Maybe I should have taken him out to dinner.' Neill, who played 96 times for his country, has seemingly severed ties with the Australian football community Neill was declared bankrupt in Britain in 2016 after a series of failed investments In his heyday, Neill attracted interest from superclubs such as Liverpool, but ultimately chose to stay on as captain at West Ham. Neill, who made his international debut in 1996, led Australia 60 times but was left out of the Socceroos' 2014 World Cup squad, spelling the end of his international career. As well as England, he had stints with clubs in Turkey, the Middle East and Japan. newsArray.title: Harmanpreet Kaur To Miss Two Knockout Matches in Asian Games 2023 Due to On-Field Outburst During IND-W vs BAN-W 3rd ODI 2023: Report
newsArray.description: The recent on-field outburst by India captain Harmanpreet Kaur during the tied third ODI against Bangladesh at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium may result in her missing two knockout matches of the womenтАЩs T20 event in the Asian Games to be held in Hangzhou, China.
newsArray.content: The recent on-field outburst by India captain Harmanpreet Kaur during the tied third ODI against Bangladesh at the Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium may result in her missing two knockout matches of the womenтАЩs T20 event in the Asian Games to be held in Hangzhou, China. According to a report in Cricbuzz, the International Cricket Council (ICC) is expected to come down heavily on her conduct, adding that Harmanpreet could be hit with four demerit points, resulting in a suspension for two international games. тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain! The women's T20 cricket event in the Asian Games starts on September 19. тАЬThe Indian team, based on its ICC ranking, has qualified directly for the quarterfinals. If Harmanpreet accumulates four demerit points, she could potentially miss the quarterfinal and semifinal, both knockout matches, and only be eligible to play in the final, the gold medal clash, if the team progresses that far,тАЭ added the report. In IndiaтАЩs chase of 226, Harmanpreet went for a sweep off Nahida Akter in the 34th over. But Harmanpreet missed the delivery and the ball seemingly went to slip off the pads. On NahidaтАЩs appeal, the umpire raised the finger, leaving Harmanpreet furious. In anger, she hit the stumps with her bat and exchanged a few angry words with the umpire before walking towards the pavilion. On the way, she showed a thumbs up to the crowd when she reached the boundary ropes. Virat Kohli Shows Nice Gesture By Giving Autographed Bats to Port of Spain Museum After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ended in A Draw (See Pic) Later on, in the post-match presentation ceremony, she came down heavily on umpiring in the match, calling it тАЬpatheticтАЭ, while adding that she was тАЬreally disappointedтАЭ with some decisions. "When a player reaches four or more demerit points within 24 months, they are converted into suspension points, resulting in a ban. Two suspension points equate to a ban from one Test or two ODIs or two T20Is, whichever comes first for the player. Demerit Points remain on a player's disciplinary record for 24 months from their imposition, after which they will be expunged," says the ICC Code of Conduct. The report added that the ICC was expected to announce the sanctions on Monday, but there might be a delay due to procedural issues. тАЬAs per standard practice, the match officials have submitted a report to the ICC and the home board, in this case, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI),тАЭ it added. It further said Harmanpreet is understood to have acknowledged her culpability in principle, but whether she actually signed off on it is not known. тАЬOnce the sanctions are announced, Harmanpreet has the right to appeal, in which case the ICC match referee will conduct a hearing,тАЭ concluded the report. (The above story first appeared on LatestLY on Jul 25, 2023 11:26 AM IST. For more news and updates on politics, world, sports, entertainment and lifestyle, log on to our website latestly.com ).

newsArray.title: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan says two Australian superstars could RETIRE from Test cricket at final Ashes clash at The Oval
newsArray.description: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring two Aussie superstars are poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval once the Ashes concludes.
newsArray.content: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan says two Australian superstars could RETIRE from Test cricket at final Ashes clash at The Oval Rumour David Warner & Steve Smith about to play final Test matches England great Michael Vaughan dropped bombshell ahead of fifth Test Warner, 36, previously stated he wants one final summer in Australia Smith, 34, regarded by some fans as best player since Sir Don Bradman By Andrew Prentice For Daily Mail Australia Updated: 06:47 BST, 25 July 2023 e-mail View comments Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring David Warner and Steve Smith are both poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval where the Ashes series will conclude. Vaughan, 48, said there was a 'whisper' from reporters at Old Trafford during the fourth Test the two Aussie superstars could call it quits when it comes to the traditional form of the game. If true, it would leave a gaping hole in Australia 's Test team that could take years to fill. 'The whisper in Manchester was....and I have no idea where they [journalists] are getting this whisper, but that Warner, if he plays at The Oval, it will probably be his last Test,' Vaughan said on Fox Cricket. 'And there was [also] quite a strong whisper about Steve Smith that it could be his last time out for Australia as well. Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has dropped a bombshell, declaring David Warner and Steve Smith are poised to retire from Test cricket at The Oval Steve Smith (pictured right) made his Test debut in 2010 and is now one of the premier figures in world cricket 'Again, I've not seen that personally, but it's the whisper and the gossip. 'It might have been the rain that gets people talking, but that was the talk of the press box, that a couple of Australian legends might call it a day.' Warner, 36, stated last month he will play his final Test against Pakistan next January in Sydney - but following yet another underwhelming Ashes on English soil with the bat, his place in the XI is anything but guaranteed. Smith, 34, has long been Australia's best player - and while events in Cape Town five years ago under his leadership led to a 12-month suspension and stained his reputation, 'Smudge' is irreplaceable in the eyes of many cricket fans. Some believe he is Australia's best batsman since Sir Donald Bradman, placing him ahead of the likes of fellow greats Allan Border and Steve Waugh. David Warner stated last month he will play his final Test next January in Sydney - but following another underwhelming Ashes on English soil with the bat, his place in the XI isn't guaranteed Meanwhile, former selector Mark Waugh believes Pat Cummins' days are numbered as Australia's captain. 'I think mentally [during the fourth Test in Manchester] he just looked burnt out in the field,' he said. 'There was so much pressure on him captaining the side and field placements and his own bowling suffered. 'You can see it's [captaincy] affecting him and you don't want that to happen to Pat Cummins because he's a key player. 'You don't want him burning out quickly.' The fifth Test at The Oval in London begins on July 27. newsArray.title: тАШMumbai Ya TrinidadтАЩ Rohit Sharma Has a Hilarious Take on Port of Spain Weather After IND vs WI 2nd Test 2023 Ends in Draw Due to Rain!
newsArray.description: The Indian captain spoke about the weather in Trinidad and compared it to that of his city, Mumbai, which has seen a lot of rainfall this monsoon season. Rain led to the India vs West Indies 2nd Test finishing in a draw.
newsArray.content: Rohit Sharma had a hilarious take on the weather in Trinidad after rain led to the India vs West Indies 2nd Test 2023 finishing in a draw . India needed eight wickets to win the match on Day 5, with West Indies requiring 289 runs. The visitors would have backed themselves to get the win after their dominant bowling performance this series, but rain prevented any action from taking place on Day 5. Rohit took to social media to share a picture of him and his teammates standing in the rain in Trinidad and made a reference to Mumbai, which has seen a lot of rainfall this monsoon.
